intro: Tetranthera capitata, commonly known as the clustered tetranthera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences and has opposite, ovate leaves with a hairy texture. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are typically arranged in dense clusters at the ends of the stems. Tetranthera capitata is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forests and shrublands.
